thread.title: Josh Donaldson leaves AL playoff game after collision at second base
thread.title_full: Josh Donaldson leaves AL playoff game after collision at second base | AL.com

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: Josh Donaldson leaves AL playoff game after collision at second base
text:
Toronto Blue Jays third baseman Josh Donaldson left the opener of an American League Division Series against the Texas Rangers on Thursday afternoon after a collision at second base.
Donaldson was a baseball and football star at Faith Academy in Mobile before playing baseball at Auburn .
Donaldson was sliding into second base trying to break up a double play in the fourth inning when his head hit the left knee of leaping Texas second baseman Rougned Odor.
Donaldson took the field in the top of the fifth inning and handled a ground ball without problem. But when his turn at bat came in the bottom of the fifth, the Blue Jays sent up a pinch-hitter in his place.
The Blue Jays said Donaldson was removed from the game as a " precaution ."
Donaldson is considered one of the top contenders to win the American League MVP Award for the 2015 season. He led the league in runs, RBIs and total bases.
RELATED: JOSH DONALDSON MATCHES HANK AARON FEAT
